text: Bulgaria's capital has become an
important staging post on the migrant
route to Western Europe that's because
the sea route between Turkey and Greece
has been largely closed down and because
these smugglers who get people across
even the most fortified border are well
organized here
the migrants gather around the Lyons
bridge near the center of Sofia looking
for the driver who will get them to
Serbia the next stepping stone before
Bora we jump out the car I'm you walk in
the jungle Follette three four five six
hours from there you go back to Serbia
in the center please purchase purchase
got together from Sofia we journeyed to
Northwest Bulgaria to the city of Vidhan
a region of high unemployment and
emigration some have turned to crime one
man agreed to speak but only on the
phone we have no way of verifying his
claims but he told me there are around
seven gangs operating in Bulgaria last
year they smuggled more than 60,000
people and that he alone made 200
thousand euros in just three months the
Magnificent Danube River in vidiian
points the way up into Europe smugglers
keep migrants in abandoned buildings
then direct them at night to others
waiting on the Serbian side you won't
find any migrants here the smuggler told
me if we do our job well and we didn't
in the Soviet era borders like these
were kept under close surveillance
nowadays the watch towers are abandoned
there are no border police around and
it's a perfect place for migrants to
just walk across the fields into Serbia
back in Sofia officials admit the way
out is less policed than the way into
Bulgaria it will be very difficult to
bring the numbers any further down
because organized crime over the past
several years now has developed
significant networks these our borders
are very long they're forest so they're
difficult to protect there are many
opportunities like other transit routes
Bulgaria has it's dangerous for migrants
only the fittest or the luckiest get
through the most vulnerable those most
in need of protection get left behind
Nik Roope BBC news Bulgaria
